image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: The treasurer insists the government can reach its target of 1.2 million new homes despite his department's advice it will fall short, and says Treasury's call for tax reform matches his own.

title.children: Chalmers 'pretty relaxed' about accidental release of Treasury advice

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: It's entirely appropriate that Albanese is meeting Xi again before he meets Trump for the first time. Xi is more important than Trump now.

title.children: As Trump turns his back on renewables, China is building the future

image.altText: plane crash london

props.synopsis: A small plane crashes at London Southend Airport in Essex, forcing the closure of the airport until further notice.

title.children: Plane crashes in 'big fireball' after take-off, forcing closure of London airport

image.altText: A group of people leave a courthouse. A man and a woman holding hands are at the front of the group.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is suing the government for malicious prosecution after it took a Supreme Court jury less than an hour to acquit him of two counts of rape.

title.children: Police officer sues after being acquitted of rape by a jury in less than an hour

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media in the White House Press Room.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes amid a diplomatic flurry set for later on Monday, with the US special envoy starting his latest trip to Ukraine and the president due to meet with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte.

title.children: Donald Trump says US will send Patriot missiles to Ukraine

image.altText: Ian wears a black coat and red scarf with hands in his pockets looking into the camera outside the a stone courthouse

props.synopsis: Ian Williams wakes up one morning to find $1,338 has been stolen from his account via two Google Pay transactions. Two years later, he's taking on NAB at the Supreme Court, with no lawyers to help him.

title.children: Pensioner robbed of $1,338 is taking NAB to court for millions

image.altText: A representation of bitcoin is seen in front of a stock graph and US dollar

props.synopsis: Cryptocurrency bitcoin has surged to a fresh high. The ASX has swung between small gains and losses after a flurry of tariff announcements over the weekend. Follow live.

title.children: Bitcoin climbs, topping $US120,000 for the first time

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Chinese iron ore imports and rare earth exports pick up
Bitcoin crashes through $120,000 to a new record
China trade surplus jumps as exports boom

image.altText: A woman with short, dark, curly hair wipes away a tear as she stands outside a court building and faces the media.

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg successfully fought for her freedom after being convicted of killing her four children. Now she is locked in what her lawyer says is a "really, really disheartening" battle for compensation.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg locked in 'disheartening' battle for compensation

image.altText: Yasser Abu Shabab wears a combat vest and holds a rifle as he sits and poses for a picture.

props.synopsis: Violent gangs have been raiding convoys of aid as they are trucked through Gaza, and behind one of the largest groups is a criminal who has reportedly been armed and protected by Israel.

title.children: The 'uncharismatic, illiterate' criminal behind Gaza's aid-looting gangs

image.altText: police walk through empty grandstands

props.synopsis: Communication breakdowns, obscured sniper views and inexperienced Secret Service agents are blamed as a Homeland Security committee hands down its final report on the attempted assassination of Donald Trump one year ago.

title.children: 'Disturbing' failures let would-be Trump shooter evade Secret Service

image.altText: A CCTV footage shows a Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) officer walking down the stairs

props.synopsis: Ukraine's security service said when the Russian FSB agent cell "started to resist" arrest, they were subsequently "liquidated".

title.children: Russian agents killed after Ukrainian officer shot dead in Kyiv, SBU says

image.altText: Albanese looks serious, behind him is a dark background

props.synopsis: We are in an upside-down world now, where our greatest potential geopolitical adversary in our own region is love-bombing us and acting like the "adult" trading partner, while our real ally demands commitments from us it is not prepared to make itself.

title.children: China love-bombs Australia while US demands to know what we'd do in event of war

image.altText: Camp site with police tape surrounding

props.synopsis: Police say they are treating the death of a seven-month-old boy near Gympie as "unexplained" as they urge anyone who was in the area at the time to come forward.

title.children: Homicide police called in after baby boy drowns in lake

image.altText: Evrim Sen inside her tiny house.

props.synopsis: Evrim Sen's tiny house on wheels has allowed her to have the serene and idyllic lifestyle she'd always dreamed of. But a council will see that come to an abrupt end.

title.children: Council issues building orders to shocked tiny home residents

image.altText: A coastline with a collapsed cliff face in front of a car park, and a lighthouse nearby.

props.synopsis: Less than a month after losing its jetty in severe storms, there are growing concerns for Robe's embattled coastline as 10 metres of cliff near its working lighthouse falls into the ocean.

title.children: At least 10m of cliff falls into ocean as Robe's erosion woes worsen

image.altText: A person holding a Synergy bill.

props.synopsis: WA's main electricity bill utility Synergy overcharged nearly 2,850 vulnerable customers on their electricity bills dating back to 2009, with the total amount owed equalling $2.29 million.

title.children: Synergy to repay $2.29 million after overcharging for power

image.altText: Rosie O'Donnel smiles and waves at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: The actor, talk show host and comedian has publicly criticised US president on social media in the past week, but it's not the first time she's been vocal against him.

title.children: Why Trump threatened to revoke US-born Rosie O'Donnell's citizenship

image.altText: The exterior of the store has two petrol bowsers.

props.synopsis: Having eliminated the need for locals to drive 10 hours to do their weekly shop, the opening of a community store in Burringurrah is helping address a number of other issues.

title.children: Driving 10 hours for groceries a thing of the past as town welcomes new store

image.altText: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera walks and has his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: St Kilda's Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera and Port Adelaide's Jase Burgoyne are offered support after receiving anonymous and racially abusive social media messages over the weekend.

title.children: AFL hits out at 'cowardly' racist attacks on star Power and Saints players

image.altText: Bus driver with blurred face and blood down shirt

props.synopsis: A Sunshine Coast bus driver was stabbed in the neck at the weekend in the fifth high-profile attack on bus drivers and passengers since March, according to a transport union.

title.children: Bus driver stabbed in throat marks fifth major attack in four months

image.altText: A man in hi vis walking his way through a dark passage, flanked by corrugated iron, weaing gumboots and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: The Land Court of Queensland recommends the expansion of a gold mine in the Whitsunday region proceeds, dismissing concerns about the potential impact on nearby water quality and biodiversity.

title.children: Court says community anxiety over gold mine expansion 'misconceived'

image.altText: A muscle car on the wrong side of a country road, as seen from another vehicle.

props.synopsis: A NSW man facing multiple charges after allegedly running over the owner of a Ford Mustang before leading police on a high-speed chase is refusing to leave his police cell, a court hears.

title.children: Man accused of axe attack, car chase, 'won't get out of bed' for court

image.altText: Table olives in hand with blue gloves on.

props.synopsis: Table olives are one of the most polarising foods — people either love them or hate them. A new Australian-style olive is trying to change that.

title.children: Why this farmer's olives now taste like passionfruit

image.altText: AWU car

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says the CFMEU's violent and disruptive actions cost it $22 million in security, fencing and CCTV.

title.children: Union 'thuggery' costs taxpayer millions of dollars, premier says

image.altText: A helicopter flying over dense bushland.

props.synopsis: Rescuers were unable to reach the couple on Sunday evening, leaving the pair with no choice but to endure chilly conditions overnight on the Queensland mountain.

title.children: Hikers rescued after 'cold, damp' night on mountain

image.altText: A van with its nose wedged into a snowdrift on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Visitors to NSW ski resorts are being reminded to drive to the conditions after more than 100 instances of cars sliding off the roads this winter.

title.children: Warning to drivers amid fourfold increase in snow-related crashes

image.altText: A white Nguni bull with brown speckles looks at the camera, the sun sets in the background creating a vibrant glow.

props.synopsis: A new generation of Nguni calves has been born for the first time in Western Australia and researchers hope to raise awareness of the unique breed's benefits.

title.children: Hopes new herd will drive interest in 'God's given' cattle breed

image.altText: A large black and white orca breaches through the dark waves at a horizontal angle.

props.synopsis: Using sightings over four decades, researchers have pinpointed three main orca habitats off Australia, with key differences between each area's inhabitants.

title.children: Decades of sightings highlight split in Australia's orca populations

image.altText: Three women, two walking arm in arm, walk by a large building with stone walls

props.synopsis: The mother of Jason Douglas Wright, who was killed by his cellmate at an Adelaide jail in 2023, tells a court of her frustration at how her son's mental illness was dealt with in the prison system.

title.children: Mother of man killed by cellmate says she was 'not taken seriously'

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: Pelicot was praised for her courage during her mass rape trial, which forced changes to rape laws in France.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot receives France's top civic honour

image.altText: Scans of a man's pelvis and lower spine.

props.synopsis: Androgen deprivation therapy is a lifesaving therapy used by thousands of men each year, but some patients are warning of serious mental health risks.

title.children: Side effects for common prostate cancer treatment raises concerns

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of an electoral official wearing blue vest.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal the WA Electoral Commission was warned about staffing issues in the seat of Roe as early as four months before the state's problem-plagued election.

title.children: Documents reveal chaos in WA seat as election inquiry remains secret

image.altText: Jayden Seales, Scott Boland and Alex Carey

props.synopsis: The West Indies collapse in a "horrid" and "really weak" batting display, letting Australia off the hook for a couple of errors in the field. Here are the quick hits from the third and final Test in Jamaica.

title.children: Five quick hits: 'Weak' Windies can't punish Aussie errors on day two
